thread.title: Bishop, Killorn key 2-1 Lightning win over Sabres
thread.title_full: Bishop, Killorn key 2-1 Lightning win over Sabres

author: MARK DIDTLER
title: Bishop, Killorn key 2-1 Lightning win over Sabres
text:
1 of 4 Chris O'Meara 
Tampa Bay Lightning center Vladislav Namestnikov (90), of Russia, flips the puck past Buffalo Sabres goalie Chad Johnson (31) for a goal   game Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015, in Tampa, Fla. (AP Photo/Chris O'Meara) Chris O'Meara 
Tampa Bay Lightning right wing Ryan Callahan (24) shoots the puck on Buffalo Sabres goalie Chad Johnson (31) as Rasmus Ristolainen (55), of Finland, and Josh Gorges defend   game Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015, in Tampa, Fla. (AP Photo/Chris O'Meara) Chris O'Meara 
Tampa Bay Lightning goalie Ben Bishop (30) ducks as the goal gets knocked over by Buffalo Sabres left wing Evander Kane (9) and Lightning's Anton Stralman (6), of Sweden,   game Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015, in Tampa, Fla. (AP Photo/Chris O'Meara) Chris O'Meara 
Buffalo Sabres center Sam Reinhart, left, celebrates his goal against the Tampa Bay Lightning with left wing Tyler Ennis, center, and center Ryan O'Reilly, left,   game Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015, in Tampa, Fla. (AP Photo/Chris O'Meara) AP Bishop, Killorn key 2-1 Lightning win over Sabres By MARK DIDTLER 0 Chris O'Meara 
Tampa Bay Lightning center Vladislav Namestnikov (90), of Russia, flips the puck past Buffalo Sabres goalie Chad Johnson (31) for a goal   game Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015, in Tampa, Fla. (AP Photo/Chris O'Meara) Chris O'Meara 
Tampa Bay Lightning right wing Ryan Callahan (24) shoots the puck on Buffalo Sabres goalie Chad Johnson (31) as Rasmus Ristolainen (55), of Finland, and Josh Gorges defend   game Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015, in Tampa, Fla. (AP Photo/Chris O'Meara) Chris O'Meara 
Tampa Bay Lightning goalie Ben Bishop (30) ducks as the goal gets knocked over by Buffalo Sabres left wing Evander Kane (9) and Lightning's Anton Stralman (6), of Sweden,   game Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015, in Tampa, Fla. (AP Photo/Chris O'Meara) Chris O'Meara 
Buffalo Sabres center Sam Reinhart, left, celebrates his goal against the Tampa Bay Lightning with left wing Tyler Ennis, center, and center Ryan O'Reilly, left,   game Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015, in Tampa, Fla. (AP Photo/Chris O'Meara) 
TAMPA, Fla. (AP) — Ben Bishop set a team record for career wins, Alex Killorn scored a go-ahead goal late in the third period and the Tampa Bay Lightning beat the Buffalo Sabres 2-1 on Saturday night. 
Tampa Bay also got a goal from Vladislav Namestnikov. 
Sam Reinhart scored his first NHL goal for the Sabres, who have scored once in three of their five games this season. 
Tampa Bay defenseman Victor Hedman, hurt when he was checked into the boards by Dallas' Jamie Benn in Thursday's 5-3 loss to the Stars, didn't play. The team said Hedman, who underwent concussion protocols, is day to day with an uspecified injury. 
Bishop won his 84th game with the Lightning, breaking a tie with Nikolai Khabibulin after making 31 saves. 
Chad Johnson made 20 saves for Buffalo. 
Killorn made it 2-1 from the low-right circle during a power play with 3:57 to play. ×
